results.title: Behaviour patterns at one year
results.creator_credit: Yale Clinic of Child Development and Arnold Gesell
results.brief_description: Portrays the behaviour patterns of a normal infant fifty-two weeks of age. The baby’s manipulation and other reactions to one, two, three, and ten cubes are interpreted and discussed by the narrator. Continues with the study of other test situations involving a cup and a spoon, cup and cubes, pellet, pellet and bottle, ball, ring and string, paper and crayon, a performance box, and a form board.

results.title: Behaviour patterns and survival
results.brief_description: Depicts the behaviour of the Slaty Backed Gull. Types of chick behaviour, innate and learned are shown by response to parent’s voice. Originally in Japanese - dubbed into English. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Behaviour modification: teaching language to psychotic children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Aller, Appleton-Century-Crofts and O-Ivor Lovaas
results.brief_description: Shows typical speech patterns of autistic and schizophrenic children, and discusses correction of these before learning begins. Demonstrates instruction methods in imitation of sounds, labelling of objects, discrimination between alternatives, recall of experiences, and development of some spontaneity.

results.title: Behavior of gases
results.creator_credit: Lee Grodzins, John Friedman, Gene Kearney and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
The Brownian motion as applicable to smoke particles is shown by photomicrography and compared with a mechanical analogue. Animation is used to develop a model for gas pressure based on chaotic molecular motion. This chaotic motion is contrasted with the orderly behaviour of gases as shown by an experiment illustrating Boyle’s Law. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Grodzins, John Friedman, Gene Kearney and Educational Services Incorporated

results.title: Begonia festival
results.creator_credit: Boolari Films, State Film Centre of Victoria and David Corke
results.brief_description: At the annual Begonia Festival, Ballarat becomes a city of flowers, music, dancing and drama centred on the famous begonia display. Mr. Tom Beaumont, the curator of the glass house in the Botanic Gardens, tends the many blooms. He is a world authority on begonia culture. Highlights of the display are a thousand double blooms and six hundred distinctive single varieties. In the gardens we see a fine display of salvias, gladioli and dahlias. Young and old admire the wonderful colour and variety of the Botanic Gardens and also the open air art exhibition. Commentary by John Morgan.

results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Lambart, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).
